Happy #PiDay!
 
Today we celebrate the transcendental number Pi, whose first few digits are 3.1415926, and which emerges, or even erupts, universally. Transcendental numbers cannot be put in direct correspondence with a countable set such as integers.
That means there are more transcendental numbers than integers or any countable set. Pi is only one transcendental number, but it is the most special of them.
How could one number out of a doubly infinite set be special? It’s a number that likes to be used. And, importantly, it is a good reason to indulge in some delicious pie!
